stimulusHtml:
Complete method  getPossibleAssemblies.
 

/**
 *  Returns the number of assemblies that can be made from
 *  all the parts on all the shelves. Each assembly requires
 *  2 wheels and 1 axle.
 *  Preconditions: shelfArray is not null.
 *                 no elements of ShelfArray are null.
 *  Postcondition: shelfArray is unchanged.
 */
public int getPossibleAssemblies()

features.html:
The  Shelf  class is used to store information about available spare car parts on each shelf in a shop. Each shelf contains a number of axles and a number of wheels, which are two types of car parts. A partial declaration of the  Shelf  class is shown.

 

public class Shelf 
{
   /**
    *  Returns the number of axles on the shelf,
    *  guaranteed to be 0 or more
    */
   public int getNumAxles()
   { /* implementation not shown */ }
  
   /** 
    *  Returns the number of wheels on the shelf
    *  guaranteed to be 0 or more
    */ 
   public int getNumWheels()
   { /* implementation not shown */ }
  
   /* There may be instance variables, constructors,
      and methods that are not shown. */ 
}


The  Shop  class maintains an array named  shelfArray  that represents all the shelves in the shop. A partial declaration of the  Shop  class is shown.

 

public class Shop
{
   /** An array of all shelves at the shop */
   private Shelf[] shelfArray;
  
   /**
    *  Returns the number of assemblies that can be made from
    *  all the parts on all the shelves. Each assembly requires
    *  2 wheels and 1 axle.
    *  Preconditions: shelfArray is not null.
    *                 no elements of ShelfArray are null.
    *  Postcondition: shelfArray is unchanged.
    */
   public int getPossibleAssemblies()
   { /* to be implemented */ }
}

 

An assembly is a car part built using 2 wheels and 1 axle. Write the  Shop  method  getPossibleAssemblies,  which should return the maximum number of assemblies that can be made from the available wheels and axles from all shelves. 

 

For example, suppose  shelfArray  contains the following  Shelf  objects.

  • The array has 3 elements.

  • Each element has 2 attributes:

    • Wheels

    • Axles

  • The following presents each element’s contents from left to right, beginning with element 0.

  • The elements in the array have the following contents:

    • Element 0:

      • Wheels: 2

      • Axles: 1

    • Element 1:

      • Wheels: 3

      • Axles: 1

    • Element 2:

      • Wheels: 5

      • Axles: 2

 

For these contents of  shelfArray,  the method  getPossibleAssemblies()  should return  4.  There are a total of 10 wheels and 4 axles. Since each assembly requires 2 wheels and 1 axle, there are 4 assemblies possible.
